title: The three reasons Tesla surprised Wall Street
text:
It isn't every day that a company grows by $8bn (£6bn) overnight, but, then again, Tesla isn't your typical company. And, after what can only be described as a tough start to the year, in which it lost $1.1bn, Tesla appears to have finally managed to turn it around.

In figures released after the markets closed on Thursday night, the US company surprised investors who had been expecting losses to continue to pile up with a profit of $143m for the third quarter, news that sent shares surging in after-hours trading.

Those gains were sustained in early trading this morning, as analysts suggested the figures could be a "potential game changer" for Tesla. It seems a far cry from the criticism heaped...
description: It isn't every day that a company grows by $8bn (£6bn) overnight, but, then again, Tesla isn't your typical company.
